channel.title: 'Global Warming Myth' blown wide open
channel.description:
http://www.guardian.co.uk/environment/2009/nov/20/climate-sceptics-hackers-leaked-emails
http://wikileaks.org/wiki/Climatic_Research_Unit_emails,_data,_models,_1996-2009
Discuss...
[I want this in the general section, its not news. It's to discuss yet more global warming facts etc etc]

item.title: 'Global Warming Myth' blown wide open
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

inertia:

It’s kind of hard to realise who know what they’re talking about though, because when some guy with over 9000 charisma comes on I just automatically believe him. That’s also why I didn’t mention the one about the melting ice cooling the sea, because to me that’s as believable as everything else I hear from people on TV.

What you hear on TV, and read in magazines, are opinions based on data. Not facts based on data. Most theory’s can be proven, but something the size of global warming can’t because you can’t bring it back to ‘simple’ formulas. You end up with opinions being right or wrong, and those whose opinions were wrong will blame you because you misinterpreted them.

Whether global warming is real or not, it certainly would improve our air quality when we’d use resources such as the sun and wind instead of using oil. The problem is, the US economy will collapse once we stop using oil. The dollar is staying alive because it’s the currency oil is traded in. As long as there is oil trade, there will be a demand for dollars. As long as there is a demand for dollars, the US can print money to pay back it’s enormous debt. Once the dollar isn’t used for oil, or there is no oil trade, the US will have to buy foreign currency to pay it’s debt, which will increase prices in the US with all it’s consequences.

Read full topic

item.title: 'Global Warming Myth' blown wide open
item.dc:creator: @inertia inertia
item.description:
@inertia wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:62, topic:315695”][quote author=inertia link=topic=412159.msg3090760#msg3090760 date=1262887670]

Melting polar ice cools down the seas, which in turn cool down the air.

I believe that’s the theory.

Yeah that’s one and makes sense, but there are so many conflicting theories and they all sound reasonable…
[/quote]

The problem is that those who have the biggest mouths usually appear on tv, and that’s where the majority of the people get their information from. There are roughly two kinds of scientists: those who talk and those who think. Of course those who talk can think, but those who think, think better.[/quote]

It’s kind of hard to realise who know what they’re talking about though, because when some guy with over 9000 charisma comes on I just automatically believe him. That’s also why I didn’t mention the one about the melting ice cooling the sea, because to me that’s as believable as everything else I hear from people on TV.

Read full topic

I believe that’s the theory.
[/quote]
Yeah that’s one and makes sense, but there are so many conflicting theories and they all sound reasonable…[/quote]

The problem is that those who have the biggest mouths usually appear on tv, and that’s where the majority of the people get their information from. There are roughly two kinds of scientists: those who talk and those who think. Of course those who talk can think, but those who think, think better.

item.title: 'Global Warming Myth' blown wide open
item.dc:creator: @inertia inertia
item.description:
@inertia wrote:

[quote=“MujaheD, post:57, topic:315695”][quote author=Mod Wozz link=topic=412159.msg3090244#msg3090244 date=1262831942]
tbh i think that everything is heating up the earth, polution etc…, solar activity (earth slowly spinning out of orbit & sun
heating up), in the end i think we are toast… and badly burnt toast at that
[/quote]
Europe is seeing the lowest temperatures it has ever seen as we speak.[/quote]
Doesn’t necessarily indicate global warming/cooling, as most places rely on currents for their weather which could be affected by a variety of factors.

Read full topic

item.title: 'Global Warming Myth' blown wide open
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:54, topic:315695”][quote author=MujaheD link=topic=412159.msg3087646#msg3087646 date=1262633839]

I don’t understand, how come the Copenhagen summit went as scheduled and there was little or no mention of this on the news? Almost no one I know has even heard about this.

It was on the news quite a lot here in the Netherlands. Thing is, they had big plans but were too stubborn to make any decisions. Ban Ki-Moon whined about how he didn’t get any sleep, and expected us to feel sorry for him.

So the world is still spending billions of dollars on what seems to be a hoax?
[/quote]

They thought they could solve all the problems on the summit, but they didn’t do shit.[/quote]

Bitches are wasting money which can be put to great use elsewhere…

Read full topic

item.title: 'Global Warming Myth' blown wide open
item.dc:creator: @inertia inertia
item.description:
@inertia wrote:

[quote=“MujaheD, post:51, topic:315695”][quote author=R.I.P RSC link=topic=412159.msg3087581#msg3087581 date=1262628636]

I don’t understand, how come the Copenhagen summit went as scheduled and there was little or no mention of this on the news? Almost no one I know has even heard about this.

It was on the news quite a lot here in the Netherlands. Thing is, they had big plans but were too stubborn to make any decisions. Ban Ki-Moon whined about how he didn’t get any sleep, and expected us to feel sorry for him.
[/quote]
So the world is still spending billions of dollars on what seems to be a hoax? And seriously, what is it with the Copenhagen summit, I wonder how much carbon was emitted as a result of representatives of the world flying to Copenhagen.

Global warming is seriously pissing me off… I take this shit personally.[/quote]

I don’t bother listening to anything I hear in the news about global warming anymore, they just keep changing their mind and contradicting each other. I can’t exactly make my own decision when I know nothing about the climate cycles of the earth, and have no reliable historical records of climate. It’s a problem for people in higher positions to sort out, not random people like us.

Read full topic

item.title: 'Global Warming Myth' blown wide open
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

eczema3:

Nuclear fission is far less useful than Nuclear Fusion, however there is no large scale Nuclear Fusion reactor yet because so far they have only been able to use more energy than they can produce from the fusion reaction.

I’d like to draw your attention to an experiment which will be a fusion reactor that produces more energy then is used.

en.wikipedia.org

ITER

Coordinates: 43°42′17.84″N 5°46′9.1″E / 43.7049556°N 5.769194°E / 43.7049556; 5.769194 ITER (International Thermonuclear Experimental Reactor) is an international nuclear fusion research and engineering megaproject, which will be the world's largest magnetic confinement plasma physics experiment. It is an experimental tokamak nuclear fusion reactor that is being built next to the Cadarache facility in Saint-Paul-lès-Durance, in Provence, southern France. ITER was proposed in 1987 and design...

Due to be switched on in 2018.

I only know this because one of my lecturers happens to be an expert in plasma physics and fusion.

Read full topic
